children.subject: Thanks! Does understanding the papers mean understanding the proofs as well (some of the math seems beyond undergrad level classes), or mainly the key contributions and terminology? Also, do you mean quizzed on 188 level RL, or more of the advanced material covered in 285?
No you won’t be quizzed on 285 lol
I think you are overthinking this. You will be quizzed on reinforcement learning in general, but nothing that's too bad. Just make sure you thoroughly understand the papers and you should be fine.

Look for other research opportunities.

All joking aside, just know that these specific RL professors are selective in terms choosing undergrads to work with; it might be the case that you answer every question flawlessly in the interview and still not get a research position, and this is completely fine. Don't restrict yourself to these professors and look for other professors that might be doing research you're interested in. Additionally if you don't get in this semester, there are future opportunities for you to try again, so don't worry too much about it.

history.content:
Does anyone who has done interviews for research positions with reinforcement learning professors (e.g. Abbeel/Levine) have tips they would be willing to share? I was given a few papers to read; beyond understanding them as much as possible, are there any specifics I should prepare for? Will I be quizzed on concepts from past classes as well, or just the papers? Am I overthinking this? This is my first time and I’m honestly very lost as to what to do. 

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Tips on Research Interviews
